main event: A military aircraft sighted an unidentified flying object on December 21, 1959 at coordinates 66-37N 171-25E.
interesting points: The object was in the shape of a fireball and appeared to be a flame with a short tail.
The object was initially the size of a pea and appeared to be disintegrating when observed.
The object was first observed descending, then leveled off and closed in on the aircraft, before continuing its descent and disintegrating as it entered the clouds.
The object was observed by three officers and two enlisted personnel for 5-6 seconds.
The aircraft was flying at an altitude of 15,333 feet with a speed of 253 knots at the time of the sighting.
sighted object: fireball-shaped object with a short tail
